course_title: People Analytics: Theory, Strategy and Practical Application

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of People/HR analytics as a field and the scope of projects that can be undertaken in an HR Analytics team.
Demonstrate an understanding of current theoretical and methodological approaches employed in HR analytics and understand the challenges in how these affect the way the knowledge base is interpreted.
Demonstrate an ability to interpret statistical analyses on HR related data, understand and report the importance of the findings (individually and as a team).
Show an understanding of the critical ethical dimension to people analytics as applied in practice, and demonstrate insight into managing the implications of ethical dilemmas.
Be able to critically evaluate the appropriate use of HR analytics projects.

assessments.due_date:
Quiz 1 Week 4 Mon - Week 4 Fri

Quiz 2 Week 6 Mon - Week 6 Fri

Quiz 3 Week 8 Tue - Week 8 Fri

Quiz 4 Week 10 Mon - Week 10 Thu
assessments.task_description:
Students will be given a series of four quizzes (5% each) that test students' ongoing understanding of material from the course.

Students will be quizzed on various features of the course, including tutorial activities, lecture material and video material (presented in the lecture and/or posted on blackboard).

The quizzes will drawing questions randomly from a pool of questions and be open for 24 hours.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be assigned to groups and given an HR analytics case study with some analyses output (along with the associated dataset for information).

The case study will be provided on blackboard.

The groups will need to consider the case study, interpret the analyses, and present the importance of the findings to a hypothetical board of directors.

The presentation will need to outline the findings, what implications the analyses has for the organisation and set out recommendations in terms of what the organisation should be considering (regarding investments in HR) going forward.

The presentations will be recorded and all group members will need to take part in the presentation. 

The presentations will be presented during tutorials in weeks 11 and 12.

Please note that you MUST be a member of a group in order to complete this group presentation task. Preliminary allocation to groups will take place in Week 5 and groups will be finalised by Week 6. Students who do not attend tutorials in Week 5 and do not notify course staff by the end of Week 6 with an adequate reason for their absence with appropriate documentation will not be allocated to a team and may receive zero for this assessment task.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will present a case description of an analytics project with some analytics output. The students will be expected to interpret the output, report and summarise the findings along with an explanation of the implications that the findings have for HR decision making going forward. The students will also need to reflect on any ethical challenges that may arise from the project.

Students will be given 120 minutes for the exam, under timed conditions.

A mock exam will be provided to students before the revision session in the last week of semester.

More details will be provided on Blackboard.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This is an in-person exam. Exam papers will be collected at the end of the exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
People Analytics - Stakeholder reporting

It is one thing to be able to analyse and interpret HR data - but "so what"? What does it tell an organisation and how can you communicate the importance of the analyses? Reporting and convincing stakeholders of the importance of analytics is key.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: People Analytics - Stakeholder reporting It is one thing to be able to analyse and interpret HR data - but "so what"? What does it tell an organisation and how can you communicate the importance of the analyses? Reporting and convincing stakeholders of the importance of analytics is key.
